action.label: If page is used in apps, don't continue with the deletion

skuid__text.contents: This page is referenced by one or more apps. You must remove the page from the app(s) before it can be deleted.

javascript.jsitem:
var config = arguments[0], model = config.model, row = config.row, pageXML = '<skuid__page unsavedchangeswarning="yes">' + '<models/>' + '<pageregioncontents/>' + '<components/>' + // Shouldn't be needed, but... '<resources>' + '<labels/>' + '<javascript/>' + '</resources>' + '</skuid__page>';
skuid.utils.writeXmlToPageLayoutFields(pageXML,model,row);

skuid__text.contents:
Using custom HTML can allow for powerful, but potentially risky customizations. Targeted use can help with some adjustments, but injecting advanced HTML, like iframes or custom CSS, is typically not advised.

It's best practice to build as much of your page using Skuid's declarative toolset as possible. We plan most improvements based on how builders use these tools. And because of that, custom HTML and CSS are not officially supported and may break in future releases.

If you do use custom HTML, test your pages thoroughly after each Skuid update in a sandbox environment. And always check to see if any changes we've made meet your custom HTML needs.

If you have feedback, be sure to reach out at community.skuid.com!
